result.execSummary:
The defendant Albert E McShepard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Possession of a Controlled Substance on or near Certain Places], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and IS Eligible for Substance Abuse Program. Sentence credit of 162 days were granted.
Concurrent with: Case 19CF1456 and Count 2

superMiscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.

No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are prescribed.

Cases 20CF397, 20CF1124, 20CM955, 21CF261, 21CF1447, 21CM045 and 21CM593 were dismissed and read in.
Inform agent of all prescriptons. No Contact with any of the vicitims or victim businesses.   Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
   Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

superTimeConds.notes: To be performed as a condition of Extended Supervision as directed by agent.

records.addlTxt: Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: Plea/Sentencing Hearing

ADDRESS INFO for Albert E McShepard
Current: PO Box 700, c/o Dodge Correctional Institution, Waupun, WI 53963 United States  (Effective: 05-27-2022)
Prior: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States
Acknowledgement of Transport to: Dodge Correctional Institution filed by the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Albert E McShepard in court, in custody, with attorney Jessica A Klein.   
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.
Cases:  20CF397, 20CF1124, 20CM955, 21CF261, 21CF1447, 21CM45 & 21CM593

Defendant enters a plea of Guitly to both counts 1 & 2.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of both counts 1 & 2.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.

FELONY WARNING PROVIDED:  REGARDING VOTING AND FIREARMS RESTRICTIONS.


Court orders the following:
COUNT:  1
Total Prison:  3.5 Years.
Initial Confinement:  1 Year 6 Months.
Extended Supervision:  2 Years.
162 Days Credit.
Concurrent  to:  19CF1456 and Count 2

Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
No contact with:  any of the victims or victim businesses.
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
100 hours of community service as to count 1 only.

COSTS:  $ 268
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of the Sentence.



COUNT:  2
Total Prison:  3.5 Years.
Initial Confinement:  1 Year 6 Months.
Extended Supervision:  2 Years.
Concurrent  to:  19CF1456 and Count 1

Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
Same as Count 1.

COSTS:  $ 268
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of the Sentence.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Albert E McShepard in court, in custody, with attorney Jessica A Klein.   

Defense has discovery - Still waiting on a global pretrial offer.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on April 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

09:22 AM Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Albert E McShepard in court, in custody, with attorney Jessica A Klein.     The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
